name: compendiously
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is large and includes many different things: The bookshop is splendidly and compendiously stocked. No 20th-century English writer has been more compendiously documented.
in a way that is short but complete, and includes everything that is important: This part of constitutional theory is usually referred to compendiously as the rule of law. His philosophy might be compendiously described as Catholicism minus Christianity.
More examplesFewer examplesThis appeal raises an important question on two aspects of what is compendiously called "the right to silence".
